content.description: Sit start with a left side pull and a low right hand crimp. Move up and right to the horizontal crack/seam and traverse to the right arete and top out.
content.location: This is about a foot or two right of the problem Four Star Arete.

content.description: Sit start the steep right arete. Start with really low right hand on a slopey bump on the wall at the two foot level and right hand on the small flat crimp at about the 3 foot level on the arete. Move up on crimps to better holds and top out.
content.location: This is the right arete on the steep backside of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand, quarter-pad, black gaston, a tiny right hand crimp, and a good right foot down on the low shelf. Power up to a good incut hold, match,  fire to the top, and top out.
content.location: Locate the sheer side of the boulder with birch trees. The problem starts at the far left end of this side.

content.description: Sit start on a flat rock with a higher, thin, flat left hand crimp and a decent, lower right hand crimp. Dyno to the shelf and traverse left to the arete and finish as for the problem Four Star Arete.
content.location: This is about 1 or two feet right of the problem Zipline.

content.description: Sit start the steep, far left arete on the backside of the overhanging boulder. Move up the overhanging face using edges, a series of right hand pinches, and a few crimps to reach a slopey, burly topout. This is a classic, Lynn Woods, old school problem for the grade.
content.location: This is the left arete on the steep backside of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start and move up and dyno to a flat shelf. Really cool. It was sent 6 years ago but never recorded.
content.location: This is on the steep face to the left of the 3 foot rock pedestal.

content.description: Sit start the overlapping steep slab.Hard!!!
content.location: It is about 12-13 feet left of the problem Four Star Arete.

content.description: Stand start with two flat crimps and dyno to the slopey shelf and top out.
content.location: It is about 8-9 feet left of the problem Recon.

content.description: This is a good, steep block located in a neighborhood.
